analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: ngas 'di dag la rdzu 'phrul gyis bstang ngo snyam nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /

original: khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: You should

analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu khyod kyis de'i dus la bab par shes na gyis shig /

translated: When the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, taught this,🔽in the innumerable,

analyzed: dpag tu med pa dag rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos te /
translated: incalculable world systems of the ten directions, the earth shook in six ways,

original: snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //
translated: and a great light pervaded everywhere.

original: me tog gi char chen po yang bab bo //
analyzed: me tog gi char chen po yang bab bo //
translated: A great rain of flowers fell,

original: sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra byang byung ngo //
analyzed: sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra byang byung ngo //
translated: and the sounds of musical instruments and songs were heard.

original: sems can grangs med pa dag gis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dag gis ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can grangs med pa dag gis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed do // byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dag gis ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Innumerable sentient beings gave rise to the mind of awakening.🔽Innumerable bodhisattvas attained the acceptance of phenomena in accordance with reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dag gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dag gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Innumerable bodhisattvas attained the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dag gis ni skye ba gcig gis thogs par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin par byas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dag gis ni skye ba gcig gis thogs par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin par byas so //
translated: Innumerable bodhisattvas ripened the roots of virtue that would lead to their being reborn only once more.

original: de nas 'khor de'i khyams kyi dbus nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chu'i rgyun shing rta'i srog shing tsam gyis sa chen po dpag tshad stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad pa brtol te mngon du byung bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i khyams kyi dbus nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chu'i rgyun shing rta'i srog shing tsam gyis sa chen po dpag tshad stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad pa brtol te mngon du byung bar snang ngo //
translated: Then, from the center of the courtyard of that retinue, a stream of water appeared in front of the Bhagavān, piercing the great earth with a diameter of sixty-eight yojanas.

original: de dag steng gi bar snang nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: de dag steng gi bar snang nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par 'phags te /
translated: It rose up into the sky above, up to the Brahma world.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di thams cad spos chus chag chag btab par gyur to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di thams cad spos chus chag chag btab par gyur to //
translated: The entire trichiliocosm was sprinkled with perfumed water.

original: @219a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba'i blo gros la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @219a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba'i blo gros la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Śāntamati,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: “Śāntamati,

original: khyod kyis chu'i rgyun mngon par 'phags pa 'di dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: khyod kyis chu'i rgyun mngon par 'phags pa 'di dag mthong ngam /
translated: do you see these streams of water rising up?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān,

original: mthong lags te /
analyzed: mthong lags te /
translated: I see them.

original: 'di su'i snga ltas lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'di su'i snga ltas lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What are they a sign of?”🔽The Bhagavān said,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: “Śāntamati,

original: chu'i rgyun 'di dag sems med kyang ji ltar 'di dag gis sa chen po brtol te mngon par 'phags pa de bzhin du gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'chang ba dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i sems can de dag kyang mngon par 'phags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i rgyun 'di dag sems med kyang ji ltar 'di dag gis sa chen po brtol te mngon par 'phags pa de bzhin du gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'chang ba dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i sems can de dag kyang mngon par 'phags par 'gyur te /
translated: “Just as these watercourses, though without thought, break through the great earth and rise up, so too will those beings who uphold this Dharma teaching and practice in accordance with it rise up.🔽They will break the door panels of ignorance and views, and the light of Dharma will be inexhaustible for them, and the eloquence of wisdom will arise.

original: de dag ni ma rig pa dang / lta bar 'gyur ba'i sgo glegs bcag nas chos kyi snang ba mi zad pa dang / shes rab dang spobs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro; ;de skyes bu de dag gis legs par bshad pas sems can thams cad kyi sems rnams tshim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni ma rig pa dang / lta bar 'gyur ba'i sgo glegs bcag nas chos kyi snang ba mi zad pa dang / shes rab dang spobs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro; ;de skyes bu de dag gis legs par bshad pas sems can thams cad kyi sems rnams tshim par 'gyur te /
translated: Those beings will satisfy the minds of all beings with their eloquent explanations.

original: 'di ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the defining characteristic of the uniqueness of this Dharma teaching.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter, on the teaching of the inconceivable secret of the Tathāgata’s speech.

original: gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba'i blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba'i blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śāntamati, “Śāntamati,🔽the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas have three kinds of secrets.🔽What are the three?🔽They are the secret of the body, the secret of speech, and the secret of mind.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi gsang ba dang / @219b thugs kyi 'phrin las yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi gsang ba dang / @219b thugs kyi 'phrin las yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the secret of the body of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas?

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris su sems can gang dag skyes pa de dag rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gcig gis bskal pa brgyad khri bzhi stong du gnas kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe'i mthar ma thug gi bar du de dag gi rnam par shes
analyzed: dper na / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris su sems can gang dag skyes pa de dag rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gcig gis bskal pa brgyad khri bzhi stong du gnas kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe'i mthar ma thug gi bar du de dag gi rnam par shes
translated: For example, Śāntamati, sentient beings who are born in the god realms of the formless realm remain for eighty-four thousand eons with a single focus of consciousness, but until the end of their life in samādhi, their consciousness does not follow another consciousness.

original: pa de rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rjes su ma 'brang ste; de nas shi 'phos nas las ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: pa de rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rjes su ma 'brang ste; de nas shi 'phos nas las ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Then, after they die and transmigrate, they take birth according to the way they have accumulated karma.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of the Tathāgata does not abide.

original: gang gi nub mo byang chub sems dpa' bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs la ldog pa mi mnga'o //🔽thugs la rtog pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: gang gi nub mo byang chub sems dpa' bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs la ldog pa mi mnga'o // thugs la rtog pa mi mnga'/
translated: From the night when the Bodhisattva fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening until the night when the Tathāgata will pass into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa that has no remainder, the Tathāgata’s mind does not turn back,🔽does not think,

original: thugs la rnam par dpyod pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la rnam par dpyod pa mi mnga'/
translated: does not analyze,

original: thugs la 'gyur ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la 'gyur ba mi mnga'/
translated: does not change,

original: thugs la tshad mi mnga'/🔽thugs la 'khrul ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la tshad mi mnga'/ thugs la 'khrul ba mi mnga'/
translated: does not measure,🔽does not err,

original: thugs la sel ba mi mnga'/🔽thugs la g-yeng ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la sel ba mi mnga'/ thugs la g-yeng ba mi mnga'/
translated: does not reject,🔽does not waver,

original: thugs la khengs pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la khengs pa mi mnga'/
translated: does not become arrogant,

original: thugs la dma' ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la dma' ba mi mnga'/
translated: does not become low,

original: thugs la kun du srung ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la kun du srung ba mi mnga'/
translated: and does not become guarded.

original: thugs la rgyu ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la rgyu ba mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that move in the mind.

original: thugs la shin tu rings pa mi mnga'/🔽thugs @220a *// la rnam par 'khrug pa mi mnga'/🔽thugs la khon du 'dzin pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la shin tu rings pa mi mnga'/ thugs @220a *// la rnam par 'khrug pa mi mnga'/ thugs la khon du 'dzin pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are very quick in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are disturbed in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are resentful in the mind.

original: thugs la g-yo ba mi mnga'/🔽thugs la nges par sems pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la g-yo ba mi mnga'/ thugs la nges par sems pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are fickle in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are certain in the mind.

original: thugs la dgyes pa mi mnga'/🔽thugs la gnod pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la dgyes pa mi mnga'/ thugs la gnod pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are pleased in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are harmful in the mind.

original: thugs la 'jug pa mi mnga'/🔽thugs la rab tu rgyu ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la 'jug pa mi mnga'/ thugs la rab tu rgyu ba mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are engaged in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are very active in the mind.

original: thugs la rtog pa mi mnga'/🔽thugs la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la rtog pa mi mnga'/ thugs la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are conceptual in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are discursive in the mind.

original: thugs la yongs su rtog pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la yongs su rtog pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are fully conceptualized in the mind.

original: thugs la zhi gnas mi mnga'/🔽thugs la lhag mthong mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la zhi gnas mi mnga'/ thugs la lhag mthong mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that are śamatha in the mind.🔽He does not have thoughts that are vipaśyanā in the mind.

original: thugs la rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs la rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that follow consciousness in the mind.

original: rang gi thugs la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: rang gi thugs la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that abide in his own mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems la blta ba mi mnga'/
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la blta ba mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that look at the minds of others.

original: thugs mig la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs mig la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: He does not have thoughts that abide in the eye of the mind.

original: thugs rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: His mind does not abide in the ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: thugs gzugs la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs gzugs la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: His mind does not abide in form.

original: thugs sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: His mind does not abide in sound, smell, taste, or touch.

original: thugs chos la gnas pa mi mnga'/🔽thugs dmigs pa la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs chos la gnas pa mi mnga'/ thugs dmigs pa la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: His mind does not abide in phenomena.🔽His mind does not abide in reference points.

original: thugs yid la gnas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs yid la gnas pa mi mnga'/
translated: His mind does not abide in the mind.

original: thugs na ngan nas pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: thugs na ngan nas pa mi mnga'/
translated: His mind does not abide in the negative.

original: thugs phyi rol na gnas pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: thugs phyi rol na gnas pa mi mnga'o //
translated: His mind does not abide externally.

original: thugs de chos rnams la mi 'jug go /
analyzed: thugs de chos rnams la mi 'jug go /
translated: His mind does not engage with phenomena.

original: thugs de ye shes la mi 'jug go /
analyzed: thugs de ye shes la mi 'jug go /
translated: His mind does not engage with wisdom.

original: thugs de 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la mi rtog go /
analyzed: thugs de 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la mi rtog go /
translated: His mind does not conceptualize the past, future, or present.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śhāntimati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar thugs yongs @220b su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar thugs yongs @220b su dag pa ste /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is thus completely pure in mind.

original: thugs kyis chos gang yang mngon par mi sgrub la /🔽chos thams cad la yang de'i ye shes ma chags /
analyzed: thugs kyis chos gang yang mngon par mi sgrub la / chos thams cad la yang de'i ye shes ma chags /
translated: His mind does not accomplish any phenomena,

original: ma thogs par 'jug go /
analyzed: ma thogs par 'jug go /
translated: and his wisdom is unattached and unobstructed with regard to all phenomena.

original: rang gi thugs yongs su dag pas sems can gang gi sems kyang yongs su ma dag par mi gzigs te /
analyzed: rang gi thugs yongs su dag pas sems can gang gi sems kyang yongs su ma dag par mi gzigs te /
translated: Because his own mind is pure, he does not see the mind of any sentient being as impure.

original: de gzigs kyang gzigs pa ma yin zhing rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de gzigs kyang gzigs pa ma yin zhing rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: Although he sees it, he does not see it, and he is nonconceptual.

original: gzigs kyang spros par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: gzigs kyang spros par mi mdzad do //
translated: Although he sees it, he does not conceptualize it.

original: gzigs pas gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa mi gzigs so //
analyzed: gzigs pas gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa mi gzigs so //
translated: He sees by not seeing, and he sees by not looking.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ni sha'i mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ni sha'i mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: That wisdom of the Tathāgata is not endowed with seeing with the fleshly eye.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with seeing with the divine eye.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with seeing with the eye of wisdom.

original: chos kyi mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos kyi mig gis mthong ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with seeing with the eye of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with seeing with the eye of buddhahood.

original: lha'i rna bas thos pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: lha'i rna bas thos pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with hearing with the divine ear.

original: gzhan gyi sems la lta ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la lta ba dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with looking at the minds of others.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with remembering past lives.

original: rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: He is not endowed with miraculous manifestations.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: He is not endowed with the knowledge of the extinction of the outflows.

original: de chos thams cad dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de chos thams cad dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: He is not endowed with all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad la chags pa med par ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la chags pa med par ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: He is not endowed with all dharmas without attachment.

original: de'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun rnams ni bsgrim pa mi mnga' zhing lhun gyis grub la /
analyzed: de'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun rnams ni bsgrim pa mi mnga' zhing lhun gyis grub la /
translated: The streams of the Tathāgata’s wisdom are not strained, but are spontaneous.

original: mngon par 'du mdzad par mi mnga' bar gnas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad par mi mnga' bar gnas so //
translated: They are not contrived.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa thams cad la gzigs so //🔽sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / @221a *//
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa thams cad la gzigs so // sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / @221a *//
translated: He sees all the conduct of sentient beings.

original: rnam par byang ba yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the defilement and purification of all sentient beings.

original: de'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mkhyen pa yang bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste; de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni lhun gyis grub cing bsgrim pa mi mnga' la /🔽mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar 'jug go /
analyzed: de'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mkhyen pa yang bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste; de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni lhun gyis grub cing bsgrim pa mi mnga' la / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar 'jug go /
translated: The Dharma of the Thus-Gone One is spontaneous, effortless, and non-conceptual.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang yang bral la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang yang bral la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas kyang mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas kyang mi 'dor ro //
translated: yet he does not abandon the state of absorption.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad la /
translated: He performs all the activities of a buddha,

original: de'i chos thams cad la chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyang gang du yang mi chags so //
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad la chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyang gang du yang mi chags so //
translated: yet his wisdom, which is free from attachment to any phenomenon, is not attached to anything.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: “Śāntamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pas sprul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de la ni sems kyang mi mnga'; yid kyang mi mnga'/
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pas sprul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de la ni sems kyang mi mnga'; yid kyang mi mnga'/
translated: The second thus-gone one, who is an emanation of the Thus-Gone One, is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa yang mi mnga'/
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang mi mnga'/
translated: He is not conscious.

original: sku'i 'du byed kyang mi mnga'/

analyzed: kha cig gis ni gnyid dang bral bar mthong ngo // kha cig gis ni 'dug pa 'ba' zhig tu mthong ngo //

original: kha cig gis ni 'greng ba 'ba' zhig tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni 'greng ba 'ba' zhig tu mthong ngo //

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' spyod lam de dag dang / dka' ba spyod pa tshad med pa gzhan dag kyang ston ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas thus demonstrated those ways of conduct and other immeasurable austerities.

original: lo drug tshang bar spyod lam gcig kyang ma 'khrugs par thams cad rdzogs par bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: lo drug tshang bar spyod lam gcig kyang ma 'khrugs par thams cad rdzogs par bstan par gyur to //
translated: For six years he taught all of them without disturbing his conduct even slightly.

original: brtul zhugs shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dka' thub shin tu brtan pos lo drug tu brtul zhugs dang dka' thub thams cad ston kyang /🔽sems can gzhan dang gzhan la ma mos pa dag gis brtul zhugs dang dka' thub gzhan dang gzhan du mi mthong ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dka' thub shin tu brtan pos lo drug tu brtul zhugs dang dka' thub thams cad ston kyang / sems can gzhan dang gzhan la ma mos pa dag gis brtul zhugs dang dka' thub gzhan dang gzhan du mi mthong ste /
translated: He taught all the austerities and mortifications for six years with a very exalted discipline, with very refined effort, and with very firm asceticism.🔽But other sentient beings, who were not interested in other austerities and mortifications, did not see him in other austerities and mortifications.

original: gzhan du na ci 'dre ba'i brtugs zhugs dang / dka' thub ci 'dra ba dag gis sems can de dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i brtul zhugs dang dka' thub mthong ba ni ma gtogs so //

translated: Except for the fact that they saw him in whatever austerities and mortifications they were interested in, in order to train those sentient beings in whatever way they were to be trained.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med @225a *//🔽pa'i btang snyoms can yang yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva is always impartial, without any fault.

original: bya ba de dag la kun tu ston te /
analyzed: bya ba de dag la kun tu ston te /
translated: He demonstrated these activities.

analyzed: dka' ba spyad pa 'dis lha dang mi bye ba phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi theg pa gsum po dag la yongs su smin par byas so //
translated: Through these austerities, he brought to full maturity sixty-four million gods and humans in the three vehicles.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: lha dang mi gang dag rgya chen po la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa na 'dug cing mkha' khyab kyi bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: lha dang mi gang dag rgya chen po la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa na 'dug cing mkha' khyab kyi bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
translated: those gods and humans who had purified their interest in the vast teachings saw the Bodhisattva sitting in the jeweled pavilion, practicing the space-pervading concentration, and then the unshakable concentration,

analyzed: bde ba myong ba dang / lo drug lon nas byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin de las langs par mthong ngo //

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: de la lha dang mi chos can chos 'dod pa chos bstan pas yongs su smin par bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan mi byed par rgyun mi 'chad par chos ston par mthong ste /
translated: Those who are gods and humans, who are Dharma-possessors, who are to be ripened by the teaching of the Dharma, see the Bodhisattva teaching the Dharma without interruption, not doing anything else.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po la sbyor ba ye shes chen po yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the Bodhisattva’s application to great compassion, the arising of great wisdom.

analyzed: chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o /
translated: It is called the entrance into the inconceivable entrance into the way of Dharma.

analyzed: bya dka' ba'i ye shes la 'jug pa bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the entrance into the wisdom of difficult practice, the taming of all demons and opponents.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntideva,

original: de ltar lo drug tshang nas byang chub sems dpa' ji skad smos pa'i brtul zhugs dang dka' thub de dag las langs te /
analyzed: de ltar lo drug tshang nas byang chub sems dpa' ji skad smos pa'i brtul zhugs dang dka' thub de dag las langs te /
translated: after six years had passed, the Bodhisattva arose from those austerities and difficult practices as they had been described.

original: klung ne ranydza na'i 'gram du song nas 'jig rten dang mthun par khrus byas te /
analyzed: klung ne ranydza na'i 'gram du song nas 'jig rten dang mthun par khrus byas te /

original: lus @225b gtsang mar byas nas /
analyzed: lus @225b gtsang mar byas nas /
translated: Having purified his body,

original: klung ne ranydza na nas byung ste 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: klung ne ranydza na nas byung ste 'dug par gyur to //

analyzed: de na grong mi'i bu mo legs skyes ma zhes bya ba des ba stong gi 'o ma bskol ba sbrang rtsi dang bsres pa'i 'o thug khyer te /
translated: At that time, a village girl named Sujātā had boiled the milk of a thousand cows, mixed it with honey, and brought it to the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: She went to where the Bodhisattva was.

translated: Moreover, six hundred million gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas each brought their own food and sat down.

original: so so nas tshig 'di skad du /
analyzed: so so nas tshig 'di skad du /

analyzed: kye skyes bu dam pa /

analyzed: bdag gi bshos gsol cig /

original: kye skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dam pa /

original: bdag gi bshos gsol cig zer ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bshos gsol cig zer ro //
translated: please accept my food.”

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntiraśmi,

translated: Thus, the Bodhisattva accepted the food of the sixty quintillion gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas, including the village girl Sun Lady, and ate it all. But they did not see each other.

analyzed: lha'i bu re res kyang byang chub sems dpas bdag gis bshos gsol te /
translated: Each of the gods thought, “The Bodhisattva ate my food.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bdag gi bshos gsol nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya par 'gyur bar shes so //
translated: After the Bodhisattva ate my food, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.”

original: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas par gyur te /
translated: The Bodhisattva ripened them all for unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpas zas len par sbyor ba dka' ba spyod pa yang dag 'phags zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s practice of austerities in the application of receiving food, called “the noble superior.”

original: zas len pas sems can yongs su @226a *//
analyzed: zas len pas sems can yongs su @226a *//

analyzed: smin par byed pa dka' ba spyod pa yang dag 'phags kyi le'u zhes bya ste bcu gcig pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the eleventh chapter, on the practice of austerities in the application of receiving food, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' lus bkrus te lus stobs dang ldan par gyur nas zas zos te /

analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po ga la ba der song ngo //

analyzed: der song ba dang / sa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu sa bzang zhes bya bas sa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu thams cad la bos te smras pa /

analyzed: sa 'dzin gang zhig mi g-yo mi spyod pa //
translated: “The one who holds the earth, who is unshakable and unmoving,

original: sred pa bsal cing khong khro rab spangs pa //
analyzed: sred pa bsal cing khong khro rab spangs pa //
translated: who has eliminated craving and completely abandoned anger,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni shing drung byon //🔽sa gzhi dag ni legs par brgyan par byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni shing drung byon // sa gzhi dag ni legs par brgyan par byed //

original: legs so zhes te sa la spyod rnams dga'//
analyzed: legs so zhes te sa la spyod rnams dga'//
translated: “Excellent!” the ones who roam the earth rejoice.

original: stong gsum thams cad yongs su phyag dar byed //
analyzed: stong gsum thams cad yongs su phyag dar byed //
translated: They sweep the entire trichiliocosm clean,

original: me tog sil ma bkram zhing spos mchog bdugs //
analyzed: me tog sil ma bkram zhing spos mchog bdugs //
translated: Scattering flower petals and burning the finest incense.

original: spos chu dag gis sa gzhi chag chag btab //
analyzed: spos chu dag gis sa gzhi chag chag btab //
translated: They sprinkle the ground with perfumed water,

original: lag na gzhong thogs de bzhin phreng ba thogs //
analyzed: lag na gzhong thogs de bzhin phreng ba thogs //
translated: Holding trays and garlands in their hands.

original: gzhal med khang gnas de bzhin par snang la //
analyzed: gzhal med khang gnas de bzhin par snang la //
translated: They are in the celestial palaces and in the sky,

original: de dag byang chub sems dpa' mthong nas dga'//
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' mthong nas dga'//
translated: And they are delighted to see the bodhisattvas.

original: de tshe me tog sna tshogs rab tu phab //
analyzed: de tshe me tog sna tshogs rab tu phab //
translated: At that time, they rain down various flowers.

original: gling bzhi pa dag rnams na skyong ba'i gzhi //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dag rnams na skyong ba'i gzhi //
translated: All the guardians of the four continents,

analyzed: ji snyed pa dag thams cad 'khor bcas te //
translated: Together with their retinues,

original: rnam par 'dren la mchod par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren la mchod par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Come to make offerings to the Guide.

original: gser gyi dra bas stong gsum thams cad bkab //
analyzed: gser gyi dra bas stong gsum thams cad bkab //
translated: They cover the entire trichiliocosm with nets of gold.

original: stong gsum 'jig rten brgya byin rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: stong gsum 'jig rten brgya byin rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: The powerful Śakras of the trichiliocosm,

analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' mchod pa'i phyir // sum cu rtsa gsum rnam rgyal khang mdzes pa //
translated: In order to make offerings to the bodhisattvas,🔽Adorn the beautiful Sudharmā Hall of the Thirty-Three

original: de ltas stong @226b gsum thams cad mdzes par brgyan //
analyzed: de ltas stong @226b gsum thams cad mdzes par brgyan //
translated: And thus adorn the entire trichiliocosm.

original: 'thab bral lha rnams thams cad rab dga' ste //
analyzed: 'thab bral lha rnams thams cad rab dga' ste //
translated: All the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife were overjoyed

original: skyes bu mchog la yang dag mchod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog la yang dag mchod pa'i phyir //

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems @242b kyi bsam pa tshim par bya ba'i phyir bskor to //

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de'i tshe chos mnyan pa'i phyir phyogs bcu nas byang chub sems dpa' grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'dus par gyur to //

translated: When the Blessed One turned the wheel of Dharma, countless and limitless bodhisattvas gathered from the ten directions in order to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag kyang 'dus par gyur to //

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

original: de la gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung 'di skad du /
translated: when the Blessed One spoke these words:

original: ko'u di n+ya /
analyzed: ko'u di n+ya /
translated: “Kauṇḍinya,

analyzed: bdag med pas 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig bdag med pa'o zhes thos so //

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig stong ngo zhes thos so //

analyzed: zhi bas 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig zhi ba'o zhes thos so //

analyzed: dben pas 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig dben pa'o zhes thos so //

analyzed: mi rtag pas 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig mi rtag pa'o zhes thos so //

analyzed: rmi lam lta bus 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig rmi lam lta bu'o zhes thos so //

analyzed: brag ca lta bus 'dul ba rnams kyis ni mig brag ca lta @243a *// bu'o zhes thos so //

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar thos so //

analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
