analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems la dmigs pa yang mi 'dor ro //
translated: And he does not abandon the objective of the thought of omniscience.

original: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa la yang rab tu rtog la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa la yang rab tu rtog la /
translated: He also realizes the objective of emptiness.

original: sems can thams cad snying rje chen po'i dmigs par yang blta'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad snying rje chen po'i dmigs par yang blta'o //
translated: And he also sees the objective of great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śamathadeva

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa ni dmigs pa la dbang thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa ni dmigs pa la dbang thob ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means and has purified the perfection of wisdom attains mastery over the objective.

original: ma skyes pa'i dmigs pa la yang nges par sems la /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i dmigs pa la yang nges par sems la /
translated: He also definitely thinks about the objective of non-arising.

original: bsam bzhin du skye ba'i dmigs pa yang mi spong ngo //
analyzed: bsam bzhin du skye ba'i dmigs pa yang mi spong ngo //
translated: And he does not abandon the objective of intentional arising.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pas dmigs pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pas dmigs pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: He also engages in the objective of non-conditioning.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba'i dmigs pa yang nyams 'og tu chud par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba'i dmigs pa yang nyams 'og tu chud par byed do //
translated: And he also experiences the objective of conditioning wholesome actions.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa la yang spyod la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa la yang spyod la /
translated: He also practices the objective of signlessness.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi dmigs pa yang chud mi gson to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi dmigs pa yang chud mi gson to //
translated: And he also does not lose the objective of the thought of awakening.

original: smon pa med pa'i dmigs pa yang rnam par mthong la /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i dmigs pa yang rnam par mthong la /
translated: He also sees the object of wishlessness,

original: khams gsum pa'i dmigs pa la yang mi smod do //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i dmigs pa la yang mi smod do //
translated: but does not disparage the object of the three realms.

original: shes rab dang thabs las nges par byung ba de ni dmigs pa thams cad la dbang byed par gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs las nges par byung ba de ni dmigs pa thams cad la dbang byed par gyur te /
translated: That [wisdom] which arises from wisdom and method becomes the mastery of all objects.

original: de mi sdug pa la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sdug pa la sems gnas so //
analyzed: de mi sdug pa la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sdug pa la sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on the unattractive, the mind abides in the beauty of the Tathāgata's body.

original: mi rtag pa la dmigs nas 'khor ba la sems yongs su mi skyo ba nyid du sems gnas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la dmigs nas 'khor ba la sems yongs su mi skyo ba nyid du sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on impermanence, the mind abides in not being weary of saṃsāra.

original: sdug bsngal la dmigs nas sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la dgod par sems gnas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la dmigs nas sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la dgod par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on suffering, the mind abides in establishing all sentient beings in the bliss of nirvāṇa.

original: bdag med pa la dmigs nas sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems gnas so //
analyzed: bdag med pa la dmigs nas sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on selflessness, the mind abides in great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: 'dod @248a *// chags la dmigs nas sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la mi sdug pa'i sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
analyzed: 'dod @248a *// chags la dmigs nas sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la mi sdug pa'i sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on desire, the mind abides in teaching the great medicine of repulsiveness to sentient beings who engage in desire.

original: zhe sdang la dmigs nas sems can zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la byams pa chen po'i sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang la dmigs nas sems can zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la byams pa chen po'i sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on hatred, he focuses his mind on teaching the great medicine of great love to sentient beings who engage in hatred.

original: gti mug la dmigs nas sems can gti mug la spyod pa rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
analyzed: gti mug la dmigs nas sems can gti mug la spyod pa rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on delusion, he focuses his mind on teaching the great medicine of dependent origination to sentient beings who engage in delusion.

original: cha mnyam pa la dmigs nas sems can cha mnyam pa la spyod pa rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la dmigs nas sems can cha mnyam pa la spyod pa rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis sman chen po yang dag par bstan par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on the equal, he focuses his mind on teaching the great medicine of the perception of impermanence to sentient beings who engage in the equal.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la dmigs nas nyan thos su 'dul bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la dmigs nas nyan thos su 'dul bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on the absence of desire, he focuses his mind on taming as śrāvakas.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba la dmigs nas rang sangs rgyas su 'dul bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba la dmigs nas rang sangs rgyas su 'dul bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on the absence of hatred, he focuses his mind on taming as pratyekabuddhas.

original: gti mug dang bral ba la dmigs nas byang chub sems dpar 'dul bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba la dmigs nas byang chub sems dpar 'dul bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on the absence of delusion, he focuses his mind on taming as bodhisattvas.

original: gzugs la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on form, the mind abides in the attainment of the form of the Tathāgata.

original: sgra la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra dbyangs thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: sgra la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra dbyangs thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on sound, the mind abides in the attainment of the melodious voice of the Tathāgata.

original: dri la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri bsung thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: dri la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri bsung thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on smell, the mind abides in the attainment of the fragrance of discipline of the Tathāgata.

original: ro la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog thob par bya bar @248b sems gnas so //
analyzed: ro la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog thob par bya bar @248b sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on taste, the mind abides in the attainment of the supreme taste of the major marks of a great being of the Tathāgata.

original: reg bya la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon pa thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: reg bya la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon pa thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on touch, the mind abides in the attainment of the soft and youthful hands and feet of the Tathāgata.

original: chos la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems nges par sems pa thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: chos la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems nges par sems pa thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on phenomena, the mind abides in the attainment of the Tathāgata's definite thought.

original: sbyin pa la dmigs nas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la dmigs nas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on generosity, the mind abides in the attainment of the major and minor marks.

original: tshul khrims la dmigs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims la dmigs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on morality, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the purification of the buddhaverse.

original: bzod pa la dmigs nas tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs dang / gser gyi mdog tu 'dug pa'i pags pa thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: bzod pa la dmigs nas tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs dang / gser gyi mdog tu 'dug pa'i pags pa thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on patience, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the attainment of the golden color and the melodious voice of the Buddha.

original: brtson 'grus la dmigs nas sems can thams cad bsgral bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la dmigs nas sems can thams cad bsgral bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on effort, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the liberation of all living beings.

original: bsam gtan la dmigs nas mngon par shes pa bskyed par sems gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la dmigs nas mngon par shes pa bskyed par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on meditation, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the development of the superknowledges.

original: shes rab la dmigs nas sems can thams cad kyi lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyun gcod par sems gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab la dmigs nas sems can thams cad kyi lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyun gcod par sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on wisdom, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the cutting off of the afflictions of all living beings and of their false views.

original: byams pa la dmigs nas sems can thams cad la khong khro ba'i sems med par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: byams pa la dmigs nas sems can thams cad la khong khro ba'i sems med par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on lovingkindness, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the absence of anger toward any living being.

original: snying rje la dmigs nas dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: snying rje la dmigs nas dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar sems gnas so //
translated: Focusing on compassion, the bodhisattva directs his mind to the preservation of the holy Dharma.

original: dga' ba la dmigs nas chos bstan pa la mchog tu dga' bar bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la dmigs nas chos bstan pa la mchog tu dga' bar bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: When they focus on joy, their minds rest in the teaching of the Dharma, which is supremely joyful.

original: btang snyoms la dmigs nas sems can rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spong ba la sbyar bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms la dmigs nas sems can rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spong ba la sbyar bar sems gnas so //
translated: When they focus on equanimity, their minds rest in the abandonment of attachment and aversion to sentient beings.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po la dmigs nas @249a *//
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po la dmigs nas @249a *//
translated: When they focus on the means of attraction,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: their minds rest in the ripening of sentient beings.

original: ser sna'i skyon la dmigs nas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: ser sna'i skyon la dmigs nas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar sems gnas so //
translated: When they focus on the faults of stinginess, their minds rest in the complete relinquishment of all possessions.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi skyon la dmigs nas tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi skyon la dmigs nas tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: When they focus on the faults of immorality, their minds rest in the purification of morality.🔽When they focus on the faults of malice, their minds rest in the power of patience and gentleness.

original: gnod sems kyi skyon la dmigs nas bzod pa'i stobs dang des pa la sems gnas so; ;le lo'i skyon la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs yongs su bsgrub par sems gnas so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi skyon la dmigs nas bzod pa'i stobs dang des pa la sems gnas so; ;le lo'i skyon la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs yongs su bsgrub par sems gnas so //
translated: When they focus on the faults of laziness, their minds rest in the accomplishment of the powers of the Tathāgata.

original: g-yeng ba'i skyon la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i skyon la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the attainment of the Tathagata's meditation, having perceived the fault of distraction.

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi skyon la dmigs nas chags pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi skyon la dmigs nas chags pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the perfection of non-attached intuition, having perceived the fault of faulty intuition.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byas nas theg pa chen po la yang dag par bsgrub par sems gnas so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byas nas theg pa chen po la yang dag par bsgrub par sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the accomplishment of the Great Vehicle, having taken to mind the Disciples and Solitary Sages.

original: yid 'byung ba yid la byas nas sdig pa thams cad mi bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba yid la byas nas sdig pa thams cad mi bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the non-performance of any evil, having taken to mind the disgust .

original: ngan 'gro ngan song yid la byas nas ngan 'gro dang ngan song dang mi khom par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par sems gnas so //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ngan song yid la byas nas ngan 'gro dang ngan song dang mi khom par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the protection of all beings born in evil destinies, bad destinies, and unfavorable states, having taken to mind the evil destinies and bad destinies.

original: lha yid la byas nas 'byor pa thams cad mthar rgud par 'gyur bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: lha yid la byas nas 'byor pa thams cad mthar rgud par 'gyur bar sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the ultimate decline of all prosperity, having taken to mind the gods.

original: mi yid la byas nas snying po blang bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: mi yid la byas nas snying po blang bar sems gnas so //
translated: He fixes his mind on the taking of the essence, having taken to mind human beings.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas sangs rgyas dang phrad par bya bar sems @249b gnas so;/
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas sangs rgyas dang phrad par bya bar sems @249b gnas so;/
translated: They set their minds on meeting the Buddha by keeping in mind the recollection of the Buddha.

original: chos rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas slob dpon chos la dpe mkhyud med par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas slob dpon chos la dpe mkhyud med par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: They set their minds on not being stingy with the Dharma by keeping in mind the recollection of the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas phyir mi ldog pa'i chos thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas phyir mi ldog pa'i chos thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: They set their minds on attaining the Dharma of nonregression by keeping in mind the recollection of the Saṅgha.

original: gtong ba rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas gtong ba thams cad yongs su gtang bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: gtong ba rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas gtong ba thams cad yongs su gtang bar sems gnas so //
translated: They set their minds on giving away all their possessions by keeping in mind the recollection of giving.

original: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas smon pa dang / bsam gtan dang / byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas smon pa dang / bsam gtan dang / byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: They set their minds on perfecting the branches of meditation and awakening by keeping in mind the recollection of moral discipline.

original: lha rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas lha thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la gnas par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa yid la byas nas lha thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la gnas par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: They set their minds on abiding in the wisdom of the Buddha, which is praised and extolled by all gods, by keeping in mind the recollection of the gods.

original: lus yid la byas nas sangs rgyas kyi sku thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: lus yid la byas nas sangs rgyas kyi sku thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: When the body is attended to, the mind is settled in the attainment of the Buddha-body.🔽When speech is attended to, the mind is settled in the attainment of the Buddha-speech.

original: ngag yid la byas nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung thob par bya bar sems gnas so; ;sems yid la byas nas sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa'i sems thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: ngag yid la byas nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung thob par bya bar sems gnas so; ;sems yid la byas nas sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa'i sems thob par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: When the mind is attended to, the mind is settled in the attainment of the mind of the equality of the Buddhas.

original: 'dus byas la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas la dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas so //
translated: When the compounded is attended to, the mind is settled in the attainment of the wisdom of the Tathāgatas.

original: 'dus ma byas la dmigs nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la dmigs nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya bar sems gnas te /
translated: When the uncompounded is attended to, the mind is settled in the attainment of the wisdom of the Buddhas.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śantimatī,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyir yid la mi byed pa'i dmigs pa de gang yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyir yid la mi byed pa'i dmigs pa de gang yang med do //
translated: thus there is nothing whatsoever that is not attended to by the bodhisattva for the sake of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i dmigs pa thams cad ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i dmigs pa thams cad ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'o //
translated: All the bodhisattva’s attentions are dedicated to enlightenment.

original: chos thams @250a *//
analyzed: chos thams @250a *//
translated: All dharmas

original: cad byang chub kyi rjes su song bar mthong ba 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: cad byang chub kyi rjes su song bar mthong ba 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s skill in means.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śamathadeva:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sa las skye ba ni skye ba ji ltar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi yongs su spyad par mi 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: dper na / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sa las skye ba ni skye ba ji ltar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi yongs su spyad par mi 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
translated: For example, in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm, there is nothing that grows from the earth that is not used by beings born in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śamathadeva:

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub kyi phyir yongs su spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyir phan 'dogs par mi mthong ba'i dmigs pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub kyi phyir yongs su spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyir phan 'dogs par mi mthong ba'i dmigs pa gang yang med do //
translated: In the same way, there is nothing that the bodhisattva does not see as an object of use and benefit for awakening, for the sake of skill in means and awakening.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śamathadeva:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na / gzugs gang ci yang rung ste de thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dper na / gzugs gang ci yang rung ste de thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'o //
translated: For example, whatever forms there are, all of them are made from the four great elements.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śamathadeva:

original: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: In the same way, whatever the object of the bodhisattvas who are skilled in means,

original: de thams cad ni byang chub kyi rnam pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad ni byang chub kyi rnam pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: all of it is endowed with the aspects of enlightenment.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /🔽sems can gang dag 'jungs pa dang / byas pa mi gzo ba de dag las byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros / sems can gang dag 'jungs pa dang / byas pa mi gzo ba de dag las byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Śantimat,🔽from those sentient beings who are stingy and ungrateful, the bodhisattva perfects the perfections of generosity and morality.

original: sems can gang dag khro ba la spyod ba dang / le lo can de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag khro ba la spyod ba dang / le lo can de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: From those sentient beings who are angry and lazy, the bodhisattva perfects the perfections of patience and effort.

original: sems can gang dag glen pa dang / rmongs pa de dag @250b las byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag glen pa dang / rmongs pa de dag @250b las byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And for those sentient beings who are stupid and confused, the bodhisattva’s perfection of meditative stability and perfection of wisdom will be fulfilled.

original: sems can gang dag phan mi 'dogs pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' khong khro ba'i sems su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag phan mi 'dogs pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' khong khro ba'i sems su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “For those sentient beings who are not helpful, the bodhisattva will not feel anger.

original: sems can gang dag phan 'dogs pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rjes su chags pa'i sems su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag phan 'dogs pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rjes su chags pa'i sems su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For those sentient beings who are helpful, the bodhisattva will not feel attachment.

original: sems can gang dag bsngags pa brjod pa de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa' khengs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bsngags pa brjod pa de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa' khengs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For those sentient beings who speak praise, the bodhisattva will not feel proud.

original: sems can gang dag bsngags pa mi brjod pa de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa' sro shi bar mi 'gyur ro; ;sems can gang dag sdug bsngal ba de dag la byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bsngags pa mi brjod pa de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa' sro shi bar mi 'gyur ro; ;sems can gang dag sdug bsngal ba de dag la byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po skye'o //
translated: For those sentient beings who do not speak praise, the bodhisattva will not feel discouraged. For those sentient beings who are suffering, the bodhisattva will feel great compassion.

original: sems can gang dag bde ba de dag la byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bde ba de dag la byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is delighted and overjoyed at the happiness of sentient beings.

original: sems can gang dag gdul dka' ba dang / dmu rgod de dag la byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas kyi sems skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag gdul dka' ba dang / dmu rgod de dag la byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas kyi sems skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva has a mind of tranquility toward those sentient beings who are difficult to tame and unruly.

original: sems can gang dag cang shes pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' byas pa gzo ba'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag cang shes pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' byas pa gzo ba'i blo skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva has a mind of gratitude toward those sentient beings who are spiritually advanced.

original: sems can gang dag rkyen gyi stobs can yin pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rjes su bsrung ba'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag rkyen gyi stobs can yin pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rjes su bsrung ba'i blo skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva has a mind of protection toward those sentient beings who are powerful due to conditions.

original: sems can gang dag rgyu'i stobs can yin pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' chad pas bcad pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / gdams pa'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag rgyu'i stobs can yin pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' chad pas bcad pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / gdams pa'i blo skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva has a mind of punishment, threat, and instruction toward those sentient beings who are powerful due to their causes.

original: sems can gang dag zur tsam gyis go ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas zab mo'i gtam brjod @251a *//
analyzed: sems can gang dag zur tsam gyis go ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas zab mo'i gtam brjod @251a *//
translated: The bodhisattva speaks profound words to those sentient beings who understand through a hint.

original: par bya'o // sems can gang dag rnam par spros pas go ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas gtam rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: par bya'o // sems can gang dag rnam par spros pas go ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas gtam rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those sentient beings who understand through elaboration, the bodhisattva should speak extensively.

original: sems can gang dag bkri dgos ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas gtam go rims su phab ste brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bkri dgos ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas gtam go rims su phab ste brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those sentient beings who need to be guided, the bodhisattva should speak in a gradual sequence.

original: sems can gang dag tshig lhur len pa de dag la tshig dang / yi ge bsnyungs te gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag tshig lhur len pa de dag la tshig dang / yi ge bsnyungs te gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those sentient beings who are attached to words, the bodhisattva should speak with few words and syllables.

original: gang dag zhi gnas sngon du 'gro ba de dag la lhag mthong gi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag zhi gnas sngon du 'gro ba de dag la lhag mthong gi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are preceded by śamatha, the bodhisattva should speak about vipaśyanā.

original: gang dag lhag mthong sngon du 'gro ba de dag la ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag lhag mthong sngon du 'gro ba de dag la ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are preceded by vipaśyanā, the bodhisattva should speak about entering samādhi.

original: gang dag tshul khrims la chags pa de dag la mthar phyin pa ma yin pas yang sems can dmyal ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims la chags pa de dag la mthar phyin pa ma yin pas yang sems can dmyal ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are attached to moral discipline, the bodhisattva should speak about the hells, since that is not the ultimate.

original: sems can gang dag thos pa la chags pa de dag la 'byung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag thos pa la chags pa de dag la 'byung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those beings who are attached to hearing, one should speak about the discourse on arising.

original: sems can gang dag ting nge 'dzin la chags pa de dag la shes rab la 'jug pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag ting nge 'dzin la chags pa de dag la shes rab la 'jug pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those beings who are attached to samādhi, one should speak about the discourse on the engagement of wisdom.

original: sems can gang dag dgon pa'i gnas la chags pa de dag la sems dben par bya ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag dgon pa'i gnas la chags pa de dag la sems dben par bya ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those beings who are attached to solitary places, one should speak about the discourse on the solitude of mind.

original: gang dag sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa la chags pa de dag la 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa la chags pa de dag la 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are attached to the ascetic qualities and the reduction of possessions, one should speak about the discourse on the noble faculty of wisdom.

original: gang dag gti mug chung ba de dag la thos pas snang ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gti mug chung ba de dag la thos pas snang ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who have little delusion, one should speak about the discourse on the illumination of hearing.

original: gang dag 'dod chags kyis non pa de dag la mi sdug pa'i gtam brjod par @251b bya'o; ;gang dag zhe sdang gis non pa de dag la byams pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags kyis non pa de dag la mi sdug pa'i gtam brjod par @251b bya'o; ;gang dag zhe sdang gis non pa de dag la byams pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are overcome by desire, one should speak about the discourse on repulsiveness. For those who are overcome by anger, one should speak about the discourse on love.

original: gang dag gti mug gis non pa de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gti mug gis non pa de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are overcome by delusion, one should speak about dependent origination.

original: sems can gang dag cha mnyam pa la spyod pa de dag la skabs skabs su gtam rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag cha mnyam pa la spyod pa de dag la skabs skabs su gtam rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: For those sentient beings who are practicing evenly, one should speak about the extensive teachings from time to time.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: mi sdug pa'i gtam dang / byams pa'i gtam dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i gtam dang / byams pa'i gtam dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should speak about the teachings on foulness, loving kindness, and dependent origination.

original: sems can gang dag rjes su mthun pa'i gtam gyis 'dul ba de dag la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gtam brjod par bya /
analyzed: sems can gang dag rjes su mthun pa'i gtam gyis 'dul ba de dag la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gtam brjod par bya /
translated: For those sentient beings who are to be guided by teachings that are in accord with the Dharma, one should speak about the teachings on superior morality,

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi gtam brjod par bya; lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi gtam brjod par bya; lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: superior mind, and superior wisdom.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba de dag la dben pa'i gtam gyis rjes su mthun par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba de dag la dben pa'i gtam gyis rjes su mthun par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are to be guided by the Buddha, one should speak about the teachings on the aspects of awakening that are in accord with the Dharma.

original: sems can gang dag sma dbab pas 'dul ba de dag la gdong bsgyur te phyis chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag sma dbab pas 'dul ba de dag la gdong bsgyur te phyis chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those sentient beings who are to be guided by being intimidated, I will turn my face toward them and then speak words of the Dharma.

original: gang dag rgyun mi 'chad par bstan pas 'dul ba de dag la rtag par rgyun du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag rgyun mi 'chad par bstan pas 'dul ba de dag la rtag par rgyun du bstan par bya'o //
translated: For those who are to be guided by being taught without interruption, I will teach them continuously.

original: dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams la ni chos kyi gtam brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams la ni chos kyi gtam brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not speak words of the Dharma to those whose faculties are not yet ripe.

original: gang dag sna tshogs kyi gtam gyis 'dul ba de dag la rtogs pa brjod pa gtan la phab pa bstan pa dang / dpe dgod pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag sna tshogs kyi gtam gyis 'dul ba de dag la rtogs pa brjod pa gtan la phab pa bstan pa dang / dpe dgod pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are to be guided by a variety of stories, I will speak words of the Dharma that are based on stories of realization, that teach through examples, and that are based on stories of the past.

original: sems can gang dag zab mo'i gtam gyis 'dul ba de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtam dang / @252a *//
analyzed: sems can gang dag zab mo'i gtam gyis 'dul ba de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtam dang / @252a *//
translated: For those sentient beings who are to be guided by profound stories, I will speak words of the Dharma that are based on stories of dependent origination,

original: sems can med pa'i gtam dang / gang zag med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i gtam dang / gang zag med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: that are based on stories of the absence of sentient beings, and that are based on stories of the absence of persons.

original: lta bar bying ba rnams la stong pa nyid kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lta bar bying ba rnams la stong pa nyid kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are mired in views, I will speak words of the Dharma that are based on stories of emptiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams la mtshan ma med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams la mtshan ma med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are involved in conceptual thoughts, one should speak about the absence of characteristics.

original: sems can smon lam la spyod pa rnams la smon pa med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //🔽phung po la gnas pa rnams la sgyu ma'i chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can smon lam la spyod pa rnams la smon pa med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o // phung po la gnas pa rnams la sgyu ma'i chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are involved in aspirations, one should speak about the absence of aspirations.🔽For those who are involved in the aggregates, one should speak about the illusory nature of phenomena.

original: khams la gnas pa rnams la rab tu dben pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //🔽skye mched la gnas pa rnams la rmi lam lta bu'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khams la gnas pa rnams la rab tu dben pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o // skye mched la gnas pa rnams la rmi lam lta bu'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are involved in the elements, one should speak about complete seclusion.🔽For those who are involved in the sense sources, one should speak about the dream-like nature of things.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la gnas pa rnams la kun tu 'bar ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la gnas pa rnams la kun tu 'bar ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are involved in the desire realm, one should speak about the burning nature of things.

original: gzugs kyi khams la gnas pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la gnas pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are involved in the form realm, one should speak about the suffering nature of all conditioned things.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la gnas pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la gnas pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are involved in the formless realm, one should speak about the impermanence of all conditioned things.

original: sdug bsngal gyis 'dul ba rnams la 'phags pa'i rigs chog shes pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis 'dul ba rnams la 'phags pa'i rigs chog shes pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are disciplined by suffering, one should speak of the noble lineage and of contentment.

original: bde bas 'dul ba rnams la bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bde bas 'dul ba rnams la bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are disciplined by happiness, one should speak of the concentrations and the immeasurables.

original: lhas 'dul ba rnams la gcig tu bde ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhas 'dul ba rnams la gcig tu bde ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are disciplined by the gods, one should speak of the happiness of the gods.

original: mtshan mas 'dul ba rnams la nga yi ba med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mas 'dul ba rnams la nga yi ba med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are disciplined by signs, one should speak of the absence of “mine” and the absence of grasping.

original: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba rnams la @252b rjes su bstan pa dang / de'i bya ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba rnams la @252b rjes su bstan pa dang / de'i bya ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are disciplined by the śrāvakas, one should speak of the instructions and the practices.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba rnams la don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba rnams la don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For those who are disciplined by the pratyekabuddhas, one should speak of the little that needs to be done and the little that needs to be pursued.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen po'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen po'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: For bodhisattvas who have generated the first level of bodhicitta, one should speak of the higher intention and great compassion.

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: To the bodhisattvas who have entered the way of life, he should expound the discourse on not being discouraged by the cycle of existence.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su spyang ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su spyang ba'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: To the irreversible bodhisattvas, he should expound the discourse on the purification of the buddha-field.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan gyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan gyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: To the bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one birth, he should expound the discourse on the adornment of the site of enlightenment.

original: sems can gang dag sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas ma tshang ba med pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba de dag la byang chub sems dpas ma tshang ba med pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: To those beings who are to be disciplined by the Buddha, the bodhisattva should expound the discourse on the absence of deficiency and the presence of results.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Santideva says:

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang / shes rab yongs su dag cing dmigs pa la dbang thob pa ni 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang / shes rab yongs su dag cing dmigs pa la dbang thob pa ni 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pa yin /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, who is endowed with pure means and insight and has attained mastery over the objective, teaches the Dharma which is not devoid of results.

original: legs par bshad pas sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par bshad pas sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa yin no //
translated: And by means of good explanations, he satisfies all sentient beings.

original: bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags khris bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags khris bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: When this teaching was explained, ten thousand beings generated the intention to achieve unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: Five hundred bodhisattvas generated the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: dmigs pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bco lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: dmigs pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bco lnga pa'o ////
translated: This concludes “The Chapter on Objects.”

original: de nas @253a *//
analyzed: de nas @253a *//
translated: Then,

original: 'khor de'i nang nas byang chub sems dpa' kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'khor de'i nang nas byang chub sems dpa' kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: within that assembly, some bodhisattvas thought this:

original: kye ma gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje 'di ji srid cig na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /🔽de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni ming ci zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kye ma gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje 'di ji srid cig na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni ming ci zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: “Oh! How long will the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi take to fully awaken to unsurpassable, perfect buddhahood?🔽What will be the name of his buddhafield?

original: de byang chub thob pa'i ming ni ci zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de byang chub thob pa'i ming ni ci zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: What will be the name of his awakening?

original: de'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor ni ci 'dra ba zhig tu 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: de'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor ni ci 'dra ba zhig tu 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: What will the retinue of bodhisattvas be like?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //

analyzed: de na kha cig ni mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis 'ong bar 'gyur ro //

original: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some will come by the Buddha’s blessing.

original: der lha dang mi de dag 'dus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de steng gi bar snang la shing ta la 'bum srid du mngon par 'phags te /🔽gling bzhi pa chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyil mo krung du bzhugs nas /
analyzed: der lha dang mi de dag 'dus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de steng gi bar snang la shing ta la 'bum srid du mngon par 'phags te / gling bzhi pa chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyil mo krung du bzhugs nas /
translated: When the gods and humans have gathered there, that Tathāgata will rise up into the sky to the height of seven tāla trees.

original: skus khyab par mdzad de /🔽sems can @256a *//
analyzed: skus khyab par mdzad de / sems can @256a *//
translated: Then, seated cross-legged, he will fill the entire great trichiliocosm with his body.🔽He will fill the entire great trichiliocosm with his voice.🔽He will satisfy the thoughts and wishes of all sentient beings.

original: thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa tshim par bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung dbyangs kyis go bar mdzad de /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa tshim par bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung dbyangs kyis go bar mdzad de /
translated: He will make his buddha-voice heard in immeasurable world systems in the ten directions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis byang chub sems dpa' de dag la chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis byang chub sems dpa' de dag la chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And he will teach the Dharma to those bodhisattvas with the Tathāgata’s voice.

original: de'i nang na gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa dang 'gal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: de'i nang na gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa dang 'gal bar byed pa'am /
translated: Among them, who is it that acts in opposition to the Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma?🔽

original: zlog par byed pa'i sems can ni gcig kyang med do //
analyzed: zlog par byed pa'i sems can ni gcig kyang med do //
translated: There will not be a single being who will contradict or oppose the Dharma teaching of the Tathāgata.

original: sems can de dag thams cad ni dbang po rno ba mgo smos pas go bar 'gyur ba sha stag go /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad ni dbang po rno ba mgo smos pas go bar 'gyur ba sha stag go /
translated: All those beings will have sharp faculties and will understand through brief teachings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de na chos kyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa de ma gtogs par rgyal po gzhan gang yang med par 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten gyi khams de na nga yi ba med cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de na chos kyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa de ma gtogs par rgyal po gzhan gang yang med par 'gyur ro // 'jig rten gyi khams de na nga yi ba med cing /
translated: In that world system there will be no other king except for that Dharma King, the Tathāgata Vajravikrāmin.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that world system there will be no ‘mine’ and no grasping.

original: sems can de dag thams cad nga yi ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad nga yi ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those beings will be without ‘mine’ and without grasping.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa de lha'i bu'am mir gyur pa gang la bsod snyoms blang bar bzhed par gyur pa'i lha'i bu'am mir gyur pa de'i mdun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs lhung bzed thogs pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa de lha'i bu'am mir gyur pa gang la bsod snyoms blang bar bzhed par gyur pa'i lha'i bu'am mir gyur pa de'i mdun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs lhung bzed thogs pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: The Tathāgata Vajravikrāmin would appear before the god or human being from whom he wished to receive alms, in the form of a Tathāgata holding an alms bowl.

original: der lha'i bu'am mir gyur pa des /
analyzed: der lha'i bu'am mir gyur pa des /
translated: Then the god or human being

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs mthong nas 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs mthong nas 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: would see the form of the Tathāgata and think,🔽‘The Lord Tathāgata Vajravikrāmin wishes to receive alms from me.’

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs @256b pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa bdag las bshos gsol bar bzhed do snyam nas yid la bsams pas 'khor gyi khams su stan dang / zas dang / skom dang / ro brgya pa'i zas sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das de la gdugs tshod bab ces gsol pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs @256b pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa bdag las bshos gsol bar bzhed do snyam nas yid la bsams pas 'khor gyi khams su stan dang / zas dang / skom dang / ro brgya pa'i zas sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das de la gdugs tshod bab ces gsol pa dang /
translated: Then, by the power of his thought, the god or human being would prepare a seat, food, drink, and a hundred flavors in the realm of his retinue and announce to the Lord, ‘The time for the meal has come.’

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa de bshos gsol lo //
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa de bshos gsol lo //
translated: Then the Tathāgata would eat the meal.

original: bshos gsol nas slar bdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshos gsol nas slar bdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: After the meal, the god or human being would become a māra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de gang gi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog la 'jug par 'gyur ba de na byang chub sems dpa' de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi bkod pas gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de gang gi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog la 'jug par 'gyur ba de na byang chub sems dpa' de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi bkod pas gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that Tathāgata enters into the inner meditative absorptions, then those bodhisattvas will abide in the array of meditative absorptions.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de ni yon tan gyi rgyu'i khyab par 'di dag dang / gzhan yang tshad med pa dag dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de ni yon tan gyi rgyu'i khyab par 'di dag dang / gzhan yang tshad med pa dag dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: That world realm will be pervaded by the causes of good qualities, and will be endowed with immeasurable [other qualities] as well.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de kun nas yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de kun nas yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that world realm will be called Samantāvaraṇa.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje lung bstan pa 'di bshad pa 'di bstan pa na srog chags nyi khris bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje lung bstan pa 'di bshad pa 'di bstan pa na srog chags nyi khris bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: When this explanation of the prophecy to Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi was taught, twenty thousand beings generated the mind set on unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der skye bar shog cig ces smon lam yang btab bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der skye bar shog cig ces smon lam yang btab bo //

original: de dag thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas yongs su dag pa der skye bar bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rnam par gnon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas yongs su dag pa der skye bar bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One had prophesied that all of them would be born in the world system called Completely Pure in All Ways, the buddha realm of the blessed thus-gone Vajra Conqueror.

original: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes rang gi lung bstan pa 'di thos nas tshim zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes rang gi lung bstan pa 'di thos nas tshim zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
translated: Then, having heard this prophecy about himself, the lord of secrets Vajrapāṇi was satisfied, delighted, and overjoyed.

original: @257a *// rab tu dga' nas dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: @257a *// rab tu dga' nas dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /

original: rdo rje de nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du 'phangs so //
analyzed: rdo rje de nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du 'phangs so //

analyzed: rdo rje de 'phangs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
translated: As soon as he threw the vajra, the entire trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: me tog gi char yang bab bo //
analyzed: me tog gi char yang bab bo //

original: rol mo'i sil snyan brgya'i sgra yang byung ngo //
analyzed: rol mo'i sil snyan brgya'i sgra yang byung ngo //

analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi lag pa g-yas par yang me tog kha dog sna tshogs kyi phreng ba dag byung ngo //
translated: And in the right hands of all the retinue appeared garlands of various colored flowers.

analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //

analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug rgya chen mi zad chos kyi mdzod //

analyzed: chos rnams rab tu 'byed la mkhas pa 'gro don bzhed //
translated: Skilled in discerning phenomena, intent on the welfare of beings,

analyzed: chos kyi rjes mthun chos bsgrub gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: yon tan rgyal grags snyan pa 'jig rten gsum du grags //

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ldan gser 'dra khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: @257b khyod ni sku yang ston la sku dang ldan ma lags //

analyzed: khyod ni chos kyang gsung la chos kyi 'du shes bral //

analyzed: sems can thar par mdzad la sems can 'du shes bral //

analyzed: khyod ni gang dag chos ston thos nas ji lta bstan pa ltar //

translated: Then, the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi and the entire retinue scattered the various precious flowers that they had in their hands toward the Blessed One.

analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba de dag gtor ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe 'di lta ste /
translated: As soon as they had scattered those flower garlands, at that time,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di me tog sna tshogs kyi phreng bas legs par brgyan par gyur cing /
translated: through the power of the Buddha, this trichiliocosm became well adorned with various flower garlands

analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: rmi lam gyi rang bzhin lta bu'i lung bstan pas bdag lung bstan to // smras pa / ci @258a *//

analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family,

analyzed: thob par bya ba med par lung bstan pa thob po /

original: smras pa / ci zhig thob pa med /
analyzed: smras pa / ci zhig thob pa med /

analyzed: smras pa / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu thob pa med do //

analyzed: smras pa / mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i ye shes lung bstan to //

analyzed: smras pa / ye shes gang lung bstan /

analyzed: smras pa / gang gnyis kyis rab tu ma phye ba'o //

analyzed: smras pa / gal te gnyis kyis rab tu phye bar gyur na lung bstan pa thob par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de dag ni gnyis su med pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'o //
translated: They both abide in the limit of nonduality.🔽”

original: smras pa / gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: smras pa / gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: “Guhyapati,

analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de la lung bstan du ci yod /

original: smras pa / mtha' gang yin pa de gnyis su med pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mtha' gang yin pa de gnyis su med pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: “The limit is the limit of nonduality.

analyzed: mtha' de nyid du lung bstan pa'o //
translated: That limit is the prediction.🔽”

original: smras pa / gang la gnas na lung bstan pa thob pa'i mtha' gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / gang la gnas na lung bstan pa thob pa'i mtha' gang yin /

original: smras pa / bdag gi mtha' la gnas na lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag gi mtha' la gnas na lung bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sems can mtha' dang / srog dang / gang zag gi mtha' la gnas na lung bstan par 'gyur ro //

original: bdag gi mtha'i gnas gang gi gnas yin /
analyzed: bdag gi mtha'i gnas gang gi gnas yin /

analyzed: smras pa / bdag gi mtha'i gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtha'i gnas so //
translated: He replied, “The extreme of self abides in the extreme of the thus-gone ones’ liberation.”

original: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtha'i gnas gang gi gnas yin /
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtha'i gnas gang gi gnas yin /
translated: “In what does the extreme of the thus-gone ones’ liberation abide?”

original: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtha'i gnas ni ma rig pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa'i mtha'i gnas so //
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtha'i gnas ni ma rig pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa'i mtha'i gnas so //
translated: He replied, “The extreme of the thus-gone ones’ liberation abides in the extreme of ignorance and craving for existence.”

original: smras pa / ma rig pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa'i mtha'i gnas gang gi gnas yin /
analyzed: smras pa / ma rig pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa'i mtha'i gnas gang gi gnas yin /

original: smras pa / shin tu ma skyes ma byung ba'i mtha'i gnas so; ;smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / shin tu ma skyes ma byung ba'i mtha'i gnas so; ;smras pa /
translated: He replied, “It abides in the extreme of complete non-arising and non-occurrence.”

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba'i gnas gang yin /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba'i gnas gang yin /
translated: “What is the extreme of non-arising and non-occurrence?”

original: smras pa / rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'i mtha' ni gnas so //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'i mtha' ni gnas so //
translated: “The limit of cognition is the basis.”

original: smras pa / rnam par rig pas ci zhig rig par byed /🔽smras @259a *// pa; gal te rnam par rig par byed na /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig pas ci zhig rig par byed / smras @259a *// pa; gal te rnam par rig par byed na /
translated: “What is cognized by cognition?”

original: rnam par rig pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “If it is cognized, it is not non-cognition.”

original: smras pa / ci zhig rnam par rig par mi byed /
analyzed: smras pa / ci zhig rnam par rig par mi byed /
translated: “What is not cognized?”

original: smras pa / rnam par rig pa thams cad rnam par rig par mi byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig pa thams cad rnam par rig par mi byed do //
translated: “All cognitions are not cognized.”

original: smras pa / gal te rnam par rig par mi byed na ji ltar kun shes par byed /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te rnam par rig par mi byed na ji ltar kun shes par byed /
translated: “If they are not cognized, how are they known?”

original: smras pa / gal te kun shes par byed na rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin te; gang gi phyir rnam par rig par mi byed pa de'i phyir kun shes par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te kun shes par byed na rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin te; gang gi phyir rnam par rig par mi byed pa de'i phyir kun shes par byed do //
translated: “If they are known, they are not not cognized. Because they are not cognized, they are known.”

original: smras pa / kun shes par byed pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: smras pa / kun shes par byed pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: “What is the knowledge of that?”

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe rnam par rig pa khas mi len pa'o; ;smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe rnam par rig pa khas mi len pa'o; ;smras pa /

original: ji ltar na rnam par rig pa khas mi len /

analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe tshig 'bru'i rjes su mi rgyug pa'o //

analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar na tshig 'bru'i rjes su mi rgyug /
translated: He asked, “How does one not follow the words?”

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe don la rton pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe don la rton pa'o //

original: smras pa / don la rton pa ji lta bu yin /

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe don mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe don mi mthong ba'o //
translated: He replied, “When one does not see the meaning.”

original: smras pa / don mi mthong ba ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: smras pa / don mi mthong ba ji lta bu yin /
translated: He asked, “What is it to not see the meaning?”

analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe don dang don ma yin pa don du mi gnyer ba'o //

analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe don dang don ma yin pa don du mi gnyer bar gyur pa de'i tshe ci zhig don du gnyer bar 'gyur /

analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe don dang / don ma yin pa don du mi gnyer bar gyur ba de'i tshe chos don du gnyer bar 'gyur to //

analyzed: smras pa / gal te chos don du gnyer bar gyur na de don du gnyer ba nyid ma yin nam /

original: smras pa / rigs @259b kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs @259b kyi bu /
translated: He replied, “Noble son,

analyzed: chos don du gnyer ba ni ci yang don du gnyer ba ma yin no //
translated: Those who pursue the Dharma do not pursue anything at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gang gis gang don du gnyer ba de ni chos ma yin te /

original: chos su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chos su mi rung ngo //

original: smras pa / chos gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / chos gang yin /

analyzed: smras pa / gang la chos kyi sgra yang mi dmigs pa de la chos gang yin /
translated: He asked, “What is the Dharma in which the sound of the Dharma is not perceived?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He replied, “Son of noble family,

analyzed: gang la yi ge rnams kun du mi 'byung ba de nyid chos yin no //
translated: that in which the syllables do not occur is the Dharma.

original: de bas na chos thams cad ni brjod du med pa /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad ni brjod du med pa /

original: sgra med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa /

analyzed: brjod pa med pa'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: su zhig bdag smra'o zhes smras pa de 'chal par smra ba'o //
translated: anyone who says, ‘I speak,’ is a faulty speaker.

original: gang 'chal par smra ba de la chos med do //
analyzed: gang 'chal par smra ba de la chos med do //
translated: Those who are faulty speakers do not have the Dharma.

original: 'dul ba med do //
analyzed: 'dul ba med do //
translated: They do not have the Vinaya.

original: smras pa / gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: smras pa / gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: ” He asked, “Lord of the Secret Ones,

analyzed: gang chos gsung ba de bzhin gshegs pa 'chal bar gsung bar mi 'gyur ram / smras pa / zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: The Buddha said, Is it not the case that the Tathagata, who preaches the Dharma, is not one who speaks falsely?

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs so //

analyzed: ma brjod do zhes kho bos sngar ma bshad dam /
translated: Have I not already said, 'He has not spoken'?

analyzed: smras pa / ngag gi las kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
